question-text: Answer the questions in complete sentences.

set1.question-item-text: Why is emotional well-being so important in seeking happiness and life satisfaction?
What do the colours of a national flag represent?
How does our body respond to loud noise?
What are the drawbacks of using hydropower?

What do these lines mean?

Hours, days, and years slide soft away

In health of body, peace of mind,

set2.question-item-text: What is the major cause of illness?
How should teachers train students to improve their communication skills?
Describe the steps of practising meditation.
What is the highest risk to humanity if AI is misused?

What do these lines mean?

Two roads diverged in a yellow wood,

And sorry I could not travel both

set3.question-item-text: Why do people need to have a nutritious diet?
How is the process of creating wind power different from that of hydropower?
How old was Schatz and what disease was he suffering from?
What are various aspects of culture?

What do these lines mean?

Steal from the world, and not a stone

Tell where I lie

set4.question-item-text: Why are diet and nutrition considered the most fundamental human needs?
What environmental problems are mainly caused by pollution?
When did the Second Industrial Revolution emerge?
How did Annie teach Helen language?

What do these lines mean?

By, on the highway, low and loud,

By at the gallop goes he.

set5.question-item-text: What is the main focus of Artificial Intelligence (AI)?
Who recommends that we should have a balanced diet to stay healthy?
Where can you find the most active geothermal resources?
Why do people need to reduce work-related stress?

What do these lines mean?

Yet knowing how way leads on to way,

I doubted if I should ever come back.

set6.question-item-text: How should a junior behave while being spoken to by a senior, according to Myanmar culture?
How can we strengthen our immune system and protect against illness?
What type of person is commonly referred to as a greenhorn?
Why are people experiencing hazardous environmental conditions?

What do these lines mean?

Sound sleep by night; study and ease,

Together mix’d; sweet recreation,

set7.question-item-text: How can people combat illness according to recent advances in nutrition?
Where can the most active geothermal resources be found?
In the short story ‘A Day’s Wait’, from which book did the father read to his son?
What may occur as a result of differences in various aspects of culture?

What do these lines mean?

Thus let me live, unseen, unknown;

Thus unlamented let me die; ,

set8.question-item-text: What does a balanced diet mean?
What are greenhouse gases, and why are they called ‘greenhouse gases’?
Why should the goals of schools and universities include the promotion of effective communication?
According to Annie’s opinion, what is the point that makes Hellen a spoilt child?

What do these lines mean?

Everything that books can bring

You’ll find inside those walls.

set9.question-item-text: Why is colour important in everything we do?
What did Annie force Helen to do in the dining room?
What qualities do people with emotional wellness have?
Why do parents need to talk with their children as often as possible?

What do these lines mean?

I took the one less traveled by,

And that has made all the difference.

set10.question-item-text: Which colour does a bank use to show that it is trustworthy?
What is essential for us to enjoy a better quality of life?
Why are communication skills important in our social dealings?

What do these lines mean?

“Happy the man, whose wish and care,

A few paternal acres bound.”
